snippet: The N.C.A.A. determined that Geno Auriemma committed a secondary rules violation when he made a phone call last month to congratulate Mo’ne Davis.
abstract: NCAA determines that Connecticut women's basketball coach Geno Auriemma committed a secondary rules violation when he made a phone call to congratulate Little League World Series star Mo’ne Davis, 13-year-old who told reporters her dream is to play point guard for UConn some day.
lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A. determined that Geno Auriemma committed a secondary rules violation when he made a phone call last month to congratulate Mo’ne Davis.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. Says Auriemma Violated a Rule
headline.print_headline: N.C.A.A. Says Auriemma Violated a Rule
